error.signature: error NU1101: Unable to find package 'PackageName'. No packages exist with this id in source(s): nuget.org

verdict.summary: NuGet restore failures occur when packages cannot be downloaded or resolved. Causes include missing package sources, network issues, private feed authentication failures, or deleted/unlisted packages. Fix by verifying NuGet sources, credentials, and package availability.

dead_ends.action: Deleting the global NuGet cache and re-downloading all packages
dead_ends.why_fails: If the package is genuinely unavailable or the source is misconfigured, clearing cache just wastes bandwidth re-downloading all other packages. The original problem remains after cache rebuild

dead_ends.action: Vendoring NuGet packages by committing the packages folder to source control
dead_ends.why_fails: Bloats the repository with binary files, causes merge conflicts, and does not solve the underlying source/authentication issue. Packages become stale and cannot be easily updated

workarounds.action: Verify and configure NuGet package sources in nuget.config
workarounds.how: Check nuget.config exists at the solution root. Ensure the correct sources are listed: dotnet nuget list source. Add missing sources: dotnet nuget add source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json -n nuget.org. For private feeds, add credentials: dotnet nuget update source PrivateFeed -u username -p token --store-password-in-clear-text

workarounds.action: Clear local NuGet caches and restore with verbosity to diagnose
workarounds.how: Run 'dotnet nuget locals http-cache --clear' (clears only the HTTP cache, not all packages). Then 'dotnet restore --verbosity detailed' to see exactly which source is being queried and what error occurs for each package resolution attempt

leads_to.condition: when restoring from a different source resolves different package versions
when restore failure leaves assemblies missing from the output directory
when restore failure is actually caused by SDK version incompatibility

preceded_by.condition: when wrong SDK version cannot resolve packages targeting a different framework
when Docker build fails during restore due to missing nuget.config COPY step

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Restore failure means the package cannot be found at all; version conflict means multiple packages are found but their version requirements are incompatible
